subject: Law
title: Refugee Law and the Right to Asylum
description: Learn Refugee Law and the Right to Asylum in one minute.

hook.text: A family flees war and arrives at a border. International law says they can't be sent back to danger.

buildup.text: The 1951 Refugee Convention defines refugees and sets their rights, including the right to seek asylum.

discovery.text: Non-refoulement is the core principle: states cannot return refugees to a country where they face persecution.

twist.text: The Convention was written for post-WWII Europe. Today's crisesâ€”climate, gangsâ€”test its narrow definitions.

climax.text: Over 100 million people are displaced worldwide. The system built for millions is overwhelmed by the scale.

punchline.text: Refugees have rights. The debate is whether the world honors them.

quiz.question: What does the principle of non-refoulement prohibit?
options: Returning refugees to countries where they face persecution
